result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
- $243.00 court costs payable to DOC as a condition of probation for Ct 5 in 22CF30
- $200 DNA sample payable to DOC as a condition of probation for Ct 5 in 22CF30

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

- Provide DNA sample
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Maintain mental health treatment and treatment programs
-Test randomly and regularly
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Pay supervision fees

- AMENDED 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

 - It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Aaron K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:45 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kristi Melinda David in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kristi Melinda David.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF30, 22CF103, 22CF115, & 22CF141.  ADA Smestad recites joint recommendation to DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CF30 and plea to Ct 5 in 22CF30.  Shelby Hilden from JSC is here in person and states DE's been testing since March and tests have been negative.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine and Ct 5- Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 22CF30. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 & 5 in 22CF30.  Court withholds sentencing in favor of DJOC for 2 years on Ct 1 in 22CF30, Staff from Diversion Agreement to provide quarterly updates. Court adds JSC balance of $433.60 to Diversion agreement.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2-4 in 22CF30, Court out right dismisses 22CF103, 22CF115, & 22CF141. Sentencing arguments. Court amends bond to signature bond.  

Court Orders: Ct 5 in 22CF30

S/W 1 Year Probation

- Court Costs: $243.00     
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00
Pay through Probation.  Bond on file to be returned to payor. 

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- Maintain Absolute sobriety
- Maintain Mental health and treatment programs 
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by tomorrow, 10/19/22 by 4:00 PM

Court notes 6 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 4:21 PM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

03:58 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: Kristi Melinda David appeared. Includes 22CF139 (PH), 22CF141 (WOPH) and 22CF30 (PTC).  ADA Smestad believes there will be a waiver on 22CF141.  Atty Dolfi agrees.  On 22CF139- S/T of Sgt Jacob Sather NRPD.  Direct by ADA Smestad.  ADA Smestad asks Court to take Judicial Notice of bail bond on 22CF30.  Court takes Judicial Notice. Cross by Atty Dolfi. Court questions witness. Atty arguments. Court at this time is going to dismiss 22CF139.   On 22CF141- Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court notes DE has missed some testing at JSC and questions DE as to why she's been missing. Testing will continue and court notes DE's positive test results.  ADA Smestad states DE has matters pending in Branch IV, depending on driving case, Court approves Branch IV to take these matters if needed. If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
